translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The forward and reverse order of conditions, the Tipitaka commentary on the Paṭṭhāna,

original: 17.10. Kusalattika, Sekkhattika🔽Kusalaṁ sekkhaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nasekkho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Dve mūlāni.) Hetuyā cha, adhipatiyā cha …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: kusalattika sekkhattika  kusalam sekkham dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na sekkhaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā dve mūlāni hetuyā cha adhipatiyā cha pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate cha
translated: The section on the wholesome triad, the section on the trainee🔽With respect to the wholesome and the trainee, there is the arising of the unwholesome and the non-trainee, from the condition of the wholesome and the trainee. (Two roots.) With respect to the cause, there are six; with respect to the dominant, there are six. … With respect to the result, there are three. … With respect to the unincluded, there are six.

original: Abyākataṁ asekkhaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo naasekkho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Abyākataṁ nevasekkhanāsekkhaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā naabyākato nanevasekkhanāsekkho dhammo
analyzed: abyākatam asekkham dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na asekkhaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  abyākatam nevasekkha nāsekkham dhammam paccayā na abyākataḥ na nevasekkha nāsekkhaḥ dhammo
translated: With respect to the indeterminate and the trainee, there is the arising of the unwholesome and the non-trainee, from the condition of the indeterminate and the trainee. (Abbreviated.) With respect to the cause, there are three; with respect to the dominant, there are three. … With respect to the unincluded, there are three.🔽With respect to the indeterminate and the neither-trainee-nor-non-trainee, there is the arising of the indeterminate and the neither-trainee-nor-non-trainee,

original: uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā pañca …pe… āsevane tīṇi …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā pañca pe āsevane tīṇi pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate pañca
translated: from the condition of the indeterminate and the neither-trainee-nor-non-trainee. (Abbreviated.) With respect to the cause, there are five. … With respect to the repetition, there are three. … With respect to the result, there are three. … With respect to the unincluded, there are five.
